description: Employee engagement and well-being are not just important—they are foundational to creating a thriving and productive work environment. Research shows that schools with high levels of employee engagement benefit from improved performance and a healthier school culture. According to a study published in the International Journal of Learning, Teaching and Educational Research, engaged teachers create better learning environments, leading to enhanced student outcomes and higher job fulfilment for educators themselves. A report by the Horton Group found that 93% of their employees engaged with well-being programs, significantly boosting organisational productivity. This synergy between engagement and well-being is at the heart of the Caelum Way, where the well-being of our people is seen as a key factor in the success of our school community. In this section, we will explore the strategies that Caelum implements to promote employee engagement and support well-being, emphasising the Caelum Way—our commitment to creating a work culture that nurtures the emotional, physical, and professional needs of every team member.

items: In the fast-paced environment of education, recognizing achievements is crucial. Caelum implements recognition programs that acknowledge and reward employee achievements, whether they’re milestones in professional development, contributions to a team project, or personal growth within the Caelum community. Studies indicate that organisations with effective recognition programs see a 31% reduction in voluntary turnover (Work Institute, 2018). Our recognition efforts include formal accolades, peer-nominated awards, and even simple gestures of appreciation that help employees feel valued and celebrated.

Fostering camaraderie and collaboration among our staff is essential. We organise regular team-building activities that create opportunities for staff to connect outside the classroom. These activities range from workshops and retreats to more informal gatherings. Research shows that well-structured team-building activities improve collaboration by up to 45% (Forbes, 2020). For us, these events are not just fun diversions—they are a way of strengthening relationships, building trust, and reinforcing the values that define Caelum.

A positive work culture expands with meaningful social interaction. Hosting social events and gatherings gives our team a chance to unwind, relax, and celebrate successes together. From holiday parties to casual Friday luncheons, we make time to nurture the personal connections that make the Caelum community feel like a family. These events contribute to higher morale and job satisfaction, reinforcing a sense of belonging.

Feedback is a crucial tool for growth and improvement. We conduct regular employee surveys to gather feedback on various aspects of the workplace, from teaching methods and student engagement to work-life balance and administrative support. This data helps us identify areas for improvement and ensures that employees feel their voices are heard. According to Harvard Business Review (2017), companies that listen to employee feedback are 21% more likely to retain their employees long-term. We take this seriously, acting on survey results to continuously improve the employee experience.

Caelum has observed that 80% of our staff do not take the full 12 days of leave included in their allowance. This trend highlights a culture of dedication and commitment, but it also raises concerns about employee well-being and work-life balance. Taking time off is essential for rest and rejuvenation, and we aim to encourage our team to make full use of their leave to prevent burnout and maintain overall health. Prioritizing time away from work not only benefits individual staff members but also enhances long-term productivity and job satisfaction.

Our commitment to employee well-being extends beyond the classroom. We offer a range of wellness programs that promote physical, mental, and emotional health. These programs include fitness classes, stress management workshops, and health screenings. Employees are encouraged to take part in activities that rejuvenate both body and mind, ensuring they stay healthy and energised. A well-rounded wellness program has been shown to reduce absenteeism by 27% and healthcare costs by 25% (Forbes, 2021).

At Caelum, we understand the importance of mental health in overall well-being. To support our employees, we provide access to mental health resources, including counselling services and therapy. We partner with professionals who specialise in stress management, work-related anxiety, and overall emotional well-being. Creating a supportive environment that addresses mental health needs is a priority for us, ensuring that our team feels emotionally balanced and empowered to handle challenges both in and out of the classroom.

description: Employee engagement and well-being are integral to Caelum’s mission and never comes as an afterthought. We believe that when our educators are supported, engaged, and well, they are better equipped to inspire and guide our students. By investing in recognition, team-building, flexible work arrangements, and wellness programs, we ensure that every member of our staff thrives both professionally and personally. As we continue to innovate in our approach, we remain committed to fostering a workplace culture that embodies the Caelum Way—where passion for education and care for one another are at the heart of everything we do.
